content.raw:
I’m starting to understand how this works. If the error is

```
[Wrn] [SystemPaths.cc:459] File or path does not exist [""] [model://vrx_gazebo/models/sensor_post/mesh/sensor_post_arm.dae]
```

  
It searches EXACTLY for `model://vrx_gazebo/models/sensor_post/mesh/sensor_post_arm.dae` relative to the model path. 

‌

If `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx`, it works \(finds the file\), as it can find the file at `/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx` \+ `/vrx_gazebo/models/sensor_post/mesh/sensor_post_arm.dae`. 

If `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/models`, it doesn’t work \(can’t find the file\), as it can find the file at `/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/models` \+ `/vrx_gazebo/models/sensor_post/mesh/sensor_post_arm.dae`, which is nonsense.
